intro: Linaria glareosa, commonly known as the golden rain larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Linaria glareosa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
